item.title: Bausch + Lomb AO60 IOL
item.dc:creator: participant

item.title: In modern IOL`s most of the posterior edges have a sharp design in order to reduce development of secondary cataract as they inhibit proliferation of residual lens epithelial cells. The anterior edge normally is not sharp as this does so far don`t have...
item.dc:creator: surgeon
item.content:encoded:
In modern IOL`s most of the posterior edges have a sharp design in order to reduce development of secondary cataract as they inhibit proliferation of residual lens epithelial cells. The anterior edge normally is not sharp as this does so far don`t have any advantages.
The phenomen you talk about is called positive or negative dysphotopsias. This is seen in some patients but most of them get used to it rapidly. Literature number is not know exactly but some authors have reported some 3 % of patients still complain about these phenomenons. The reason is not completely clear yet. Material with a high refractive index and a sharp posterior edge sometimes are being made responsible as they may induce internal light reflections. Another reason is discussed. The circumlinear coverage of the anterior optic by the anterior capsule may produce as well reflecions of light which may cause the dysphotopsias.
In fact there are new lenses in development which will have their optic in front of the anterior capsule being fixed within the capsulorhexis. In order to create always a perfect capsular opening a femtosecondlaser assisted technology has to be applied.
Generally it is not described that the B+L AO 60 is more prone to dysphotopsias

item.title: Precautions after Surgury to be obseved for Catract using Mono IOL Lens
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
Good Morning Sir/Madam,
I am being Diabetic Patient suffering Cataract Surury by Eye Surgeon for Right Eye they had advised me Mono IOL Lens and my Lens Power is 19.5 D & my sugar Level Lasing is 100 Mg/dl and after Food is 113 Mg/dl and Random Sugar is 98 mg/dl pls advise me what Precaution should i should observe after surgery as i got surgery my left Eye in 2011 at Private Hospital but after one year faced problem seeing objects so i got Treatment at Safdarjung Hospital by Laser and they cured very effectively and Now going my Sugary performed at Safdarjung Hospial ,New Delhi at Eye Department and if any spectates is required by me for far and Near Vision as in case of left Eye slight No is there say 0.5 D for far vision and Near vision also.

item.title: Symfony IOL add power and spectacle plane add power comparison
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
1. What is the spectacle plane add-power of the new Symfony 1.75 IOL?
2. If an additional .50 diopters is added to one of the Symfony IOL lenses (providing a bit more reading ability in one eye), how does the .50D compare to the spectacle plane add-power?
My understanding is that there is a multiplier when comparing powers of IOLs and spectacle lenses. For example an IOL 4 add power = 3 add power of a spectacle lens (a .75 multiplier). Therefore, does the Symfony 1.75 IOL actually provide about 1.3 diopters? And if an additional .50 diopters is added, is it actually .37 diopters, providing a total of 1.67 (1.3 + .37) diopters, rather than 2.25 (1.75 + .50) diopters?
I look forward to the clarification.

item.title: IOL Question
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
1. What is the spectacle plane add-power of the new Symfony 1.75 IOL?
2. If an additional .50 diopters is added to one of the Symfony IOL lenses (providing a bit more reading ability in one eye), is the .50D a spectacle lens plane power or does it need to be converted to IOL power to know the actual additional correction of the lens....see below:
My understanding is that there is a multiplier when comparing powers of IOLs and spectacle lenses. For example an IOL 4 add power = 3 add power of a spectacle lens (this is a .75 multiplier). Therefore, does the Symfony 1.75 IOL actually provide about 1.3 diopters? And if an additional .50 diopters is added, is it actually .37 diopters, providing a total of 1.67 (1.3 + .37) diopters, rather than 2.25 (1.75 + .50) diopters?

item.title: MA60MA lens
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
Is this MA60MA lens a traditional lens replacement for cataract surgery or is it one of the more expensive lenses?
My eye doc gave me three choices for lenses and highly recommended the astigmatic correction lens in lieu of the Lifestyle, Crystalens, etc., and definitely did not recommend the traditional lens.

item.title: Symphony ZXR00 lens
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded: I had cataract surgery February 21 and had Symphony Model ZXR00, Diopter +20.0D SE added to my eye. A couple of days after surgery my mid to distance sight was not too bad, but not like my other eye. Contrast was worse and sharpness was worse. Since then from about 20 feet out my vision is blurry. My sight at computer distance is good with this eye. I have the same symptoms as others with shadow lines, occasional flickering, definitely starburst and halo's all the time. Is it possible the lens moved and that is who my mid to distance vision actually got worse? Is the alignment or placement of the lens critical? I do photography and this is my dominant eye, so it's critical I get it as right as possible. I'm thinking about making another appointment with my surgeon and possible going to a different doctor an get their opinion.

item.title: Best Multifocal ?? for Me
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded: What is the BEST Multifocal - taking into account my age 68 but very healthy. Surely there must be minimum cost difference between the cheapest single focus & the very best Multifocal. Less than a year ago a surgeon installed a Single Focus lens implant which has left me with poor eyesight worse than original. I asked about Multifocal and he said he didn't believe in them and he had been doing this for a hundred years and he knew best. OUTCOME was Worse sight than original. The first few weeks after the operation my eyesight was magnificent, I could read at about 2 foot & see the tree 100 yards away clearer than when I had perfect sight 50 year ago. . But after a month or two, that eye couldn't focus on print within 3 foot or mid range as TV, or any distant object. I went back and told him- he said - "Give it a few months to settle in. I did. Then it was Worse. He personally did more eye tests to tell me my eyesight was Perfect- I had 25/25 Vision according to him. FACTUALLY I had to use glasses for all 3 ranges. The better focus is 4 to 6 metres- but still not right. He says he cannot remove these lens he put in.. ?? What I want is the BEST MULTIFOCAL installed in the other far better eye- NOT by HIM of course. Which is the BEST ? Thanks. SB Bond. bondx248@gmail.com

item.title: Post cataract surgery lens aberrations
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
Hello Doctor,
I had cataract surgery mid August 2017 and am still experiencing halos with artificial light on the lens. Also when light passes through the lens from the side I experience a light refracting through the lens simular to looking through a lace film.
The lens is monofocal Abbott ZCT 300, and I'm not sure if it spherical or aspherical.
What would cause the aberrrations? I thought it may be because the lenns edge is blunt.
My other eye's IOL is toric and I have no aberrations at all.
I'm doing research because I'm contemplation having the lens removed and replaced and do not want to replace it with another poor lens. Additionally, which manufacturers produce toric lenses for slight astigmatism?
I certainly appreciate any help you can offer!
Kimi Quick Kimi@kimiquick.com

item.title: monofocal versus multifocal
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded: Can I replace my monofocal lens with a multi focal lens so I can see better in the distance

item.title: SHADOW IN EYE
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
I had a cataract removed from my left eye and since then have a shadow appearing in the outside part of the eye. The surgery was successful and I can see very good in that eye. My research reveal that it is most likely demystifying dysphoto0sia temporal darkness due to the type lens installed. I have a model MI60L with +21.50 power. This will never to away but it something I could get used to in time. I need to have my other eye done but don't want to unless I can find out a lens that can be inserted that will not cause the problem in the eye.
Do you have any suggestion?. The MI60L is a squared edge lens that is supposed to cause the problem.
 
Harold Stephens
harold9735@aol.com
636-899-1055

item.title: symphony multi focal lens result with ghost vision
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded: I had cataract surgery in August 2017 for my right eye with a symphony multi focal lens implant. As a result I have ghost vision and see halos and starbursts. I went to three different eye Dr's for a second opinion and was told that I have an astigmatism and it can be corrected with Lasik. So I went and had PRK Lasik 4 weeks ago and as a result the ghost vision halos and starbursts are much worse. I realize it takes awhile to heal and with time I really hope that my vision improves. If my vision doesn't improve what can I do? my e-mail is dream2view@yahoo.com

item.title: BIOMETRY for Evaluation
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
Hello Sir, How do you do? I hope everything is fine and wish you great professional success. Sir, I would like to request some information regarding
CATARACT SURGERY. I am a Cataract Patient. I had my Cataract Extraction Phacoemulsification Surgery replacing my RIGHT Eye's natural lens with
Alcon AcrySOF IQ Aspheric Natural IOL model SN60WF last week. I have some Questions regarding my Phaco surgery with PCIOL.
Sir, the BIOMETRY with IOL-Master with SRK-II FORMULA has shown 24.50 DIOPTER IOL is needed. But during surgery the surgeon
IMPLANTED a 23.50 DIOPTER IOL.Why??? I asked him and the surgeon said that CAPSULAR BAG is not Blasted or Ruptured but the Patient would
become MYOPIC if 24.50 DIOPTER is used, so he used 23.50 DIOPTER. Sir, is it NORMAL phenomena or the surgeon had made a mistake? I do not
know the ELP or did the Surgeon put the IOL on the Capsular Bag or on the Cylius-Sulcus. Is there any IOL-Power Calculating Facilities in the O.T?
Immediately after I came out of the Operation Theatre(OPD basis), I looked at the mirror and I found some thing like a thin cloudy curtain or plastic-
sheet on my Operated eye(Right) which was Teared and Torned. The next day while I visited my Surgeon for Post-Operative Check-Up, he said
Everything is fine and normal. But during Phaco Surgery, the Natural Eye lens is cut in a circular shape and Emulsified with UltraSound Vibration and a
INCISION is made with only 2-to-3 milimeter, right? I would like to know whether I am Far-Sighted / Near-Sighted / Intermediate-Sighted on the
Operated Right Eye? I am very Anxious about my Cataract Surgery Post-Operative VISION Correction as I want to have BEST Corrected Vision to see
DISTANT. Sir, I am ATTACHING my BIOMETRY and other file for your kind and generous evaluations. Please also NOTICE the following information:
Patient= FEMALE Age= 60 years EYE= RIGHT Blood Pressure = 95/140 mmhg (medicine is continueing) Diabetes= NO E.C.G = Within Normal Limit HbsAg = Negative RBS = 6.0 mmol/L
====================================
